results.name: Aluminosugilite
results.tlform: Aggregates of small prismatic and/or granular crystals up to 1 mm in length
results.occurrence: Manganiferous metacherts
results.aboutname: Named for being the aluminum analogue of sugilite.  There is a technical discussion in Nagashima et al. (2020) on why the modifier was made a prefix rather than a suffix.
results.other: Insoluble in HCl, HNO3 and H2SO4
results.type_specimen_store: Type material is deposited in the mineralogical collections of the National Museum of Nature and Science, Tsukuba, Japan, specimen numbers NSMMF- 16503
results.commentcrystal: Cell parameters for single crystal X-ray.  Powder gave slightly smaller dimensions.

results.name: Laurentthomasite
results.tlform: Euhedral {0001} hexagonal crystals, maximum 15 mm large and 5 mm thick.
results.occurrence: Quartz-syenite pegmatites.
results.aboutname: Named after Laurent Thomas (b. 1971) of Polychrom France. He is a geologist, prospector and mineral dealer, especially for African areas such as Madagascar.
results.morphology: Observed forms are {1010} and {0001}.
results.opticalcomments: Strong dichroism with cobalt blue and green-yellow colours when observed along [0001] and [1000], respectively.
results.type_specimen_store: Mineralogical collections of the Muséum National d’Histoire Naturelle, Paris, France, catalogue numbers 218.1_a (holotype), 218.1_b and 218.1_c (cotypes).
results.commentcolor: The origin of dichroism lies in the presence of the transition metal ions Fe2+ and Fe3+, located in octahedral A sites and tetrahedral T(2) sites, respectively, and inter-valence charge transfer between them.

results.name: Johnkoivulaite
results.tlform: A single, irregularly shaped crystal, ca. 5.8×5.7×5.5 mm in size; geometric growth patterns observable.
results.occurrence: Alluvial deposit.
results.aboutname: Named in honour of John Ilmarii Koivula (b. 1949, Spokane, Washington, USA), GIA (Gemological Institute of America) researcher, for his many contributions in gemstone research (especially inclusions in gemstones) and photomicrography. He coathored the books 'Photoatlas of Inclusions in Gemstones' (three volumes) and 'The Microworld of Diamonds'.
results.opticalpleochorismdesc: deep violet (E||c) to nearly colorless (E┴c)
results.type_specimen_store: In the mineralogical collections of the Gemological Museum, Gemological Institute of America, 5355 Armada Drive, Carlsbad, CA 92008, USA, catalogue number 41653

results.name: Caesian Bazzite
results.description_short:
Juve & Bergstøl (1990) described a bazzite with ca. 3 weight%  Cs2O from Heftetjern, Tørdal, Telemark, Norway, which they designated as a caesian bazzite.
Later, a cesian bazzite from Italy was described by Gramaccioli et al. (2000).

results.name: Ermakovite
results.tlform: Tabular or prismatic, hexagonal crystals, up to 200 μm, with the c (001), m (010), and p (014) forms; commonly as spherolitic and multi-twinned intergrowths.
results.occurrence: Coal-fire-driven exhalative processes within a fumarole.
results.aboutname: Named in honor of Nikolai Porfirievich Ermakov (Николай Порфирьевич Ермаков) (16 November 1913, Kondurchinskaya fortress, Samara province, Russia - 25 September 1993, Moscow , Russia), professor of mineralogy, head of the thermobarogeochemistry lab and founder of the Earth Science Museum at Moscow State University (Russia).
results.other: Insoluble in water, HCl, HNO<sub>3</sub> or organic solvents.
results.morphology: Tabular or prismatic, hexagonal crystals, up to 200 μm, with the c (001), m (010), and p (014) forms; commonly as spherolitic and multi-twinned intergrowths.
results.type_specimen_store: Type material is deposited in the collections of the Fersman Mineralogical Museum, Russian Academy of Sciences, Leninskiy Prospekt 18-2, Moscow 119071, Russia, registration number 5525/1.
results.commentcolor: Zoned with a transparent yellowish core and semi-transparent yellow rim.

results.name: Steudelite
results.mindat_formula_note: also given as (Na<sub>3</sub>☐)[(K,Na)<sub>17</sub>Ca<sub>7</sub>]Ca<sub>4</sub>(Al<sub>24</sub>Si<sub>24</sub>O<sub>96</sub>)(SO<sub>3</sub>)<sub>6</sub>F<sub>6</sub>·4H<sub>2</sub>O
results.tlform: thick-tabular, isometric and short-prismatic crystals, up to 7 mm in size
results.occurrence: syenite ejectum
results.aboutname: for Prof. Ralf Steudel (25 March 1937 – 12 February 2021) - an outstanding German chemist, specializing in chemistry of sulfur
results.ir: confirms H<sub>2</sub>O, SO<sub>3</sub><sup>2–</sup>, and minor SO<sub>4</sub><sup>2-</sup>
results.type_specimen_store: collections of the Fersman Mineralogical Museum, Russian Academy of Sciences, Leninskiy Prospekt 18-2, Moscow 119071, Russia, registration number 5665/1
